questions.question: What is Newton's First Law of Motion?

options.text: An object at rest stays at rest, and an object in motion stays in motion
For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction
Energy cannot be created or destroyed

questions.explanation: Newton's First Law states that an object will remain at rest or in uniform motion in a straight line unless acted upon by an external force.

questions.question: What is the SI unit of force?
questions.explanation: The SI unit of force is the Newton (N), named after Sir Isaac Newton.

questions.question: What is the First Law of Thermodynamics?

options.text: Energy cannot be created or destroyed
Heat flows from cold to hot
Pressure and volume are inversely proportional
Temperature is constant in an adiabatic process

questions.explanation: The First Law of Thermodynamics states that energy cannot be created or destroyed, only converted from one form to another.

questions.question: What is the atomic number of an element?
questions.explanation: The atomic number is the number of protons in the nucleus of an atom.

questions.question: What is the powerhouse of the cell?
questions.explanation: Mitochondria are known as the powerhouse of the cell because they generate most of the cell's supply of adenosine triphosphate (ATP).
